review: I figured for the price, the Chromecast device was worth a shot.  It is significantly less expensive than any of the other popular streaming units out there (Roku, Apple TV, etc.).  I will say that for the content that it is designed, the picture is great - Netflix, Hulu, Google, Play, Youtube. While it doesn't surprise me, I wish amazon video was supported. For any non-chromecast supported content, the image is great, but I have found that the audio lags. I tried TBS's streaming channel, and it looked great on the cast, but as the content went on, the audio lagged farther and farther behind.Setup is a snap - you plug it in to your HDMI slot on your video device, register your unit and connect it to your wireless network.  Chrome has a plugin that allows you to cast any content from your desktop, laptop, mobile device, etc. It's pretty awesome as it is, but it would be super awesome if they somehow snuck in an OTA digital receiver.  My guess is that they didn't want to mess around with antennae.Pros:Great price pointEasy setupVideo and audio quality is superb for applications that are paired with chromecastCompact and unobtrusiveCons:Needs more content available (probably to be increased in the future)Non-chromecast content quality is sketchy.Overall worth the investment if you have a nice TV or projector and you want to watch your Netflix, Hulu or Google Play  streaming content  on your home theater setup.
